body.p:
Somerset Ky
Jany 8th 1861
Gov, Magoffin
Dear Sir

Judgments of Commonwealth of J Marcum for $500. rendered in the Wayne Circuit Court at -- Term 1859. upon forfeited bail bond ought I think to be remitted, Marcum followed Beeler (the principal) to Lebenon where he (Beeler) was accidentally Killed otherwise he would have been brought back & tried, Marcum is a poor man industrious & honest, the fine if not remitted will utterly destroy him, this is the Case to which I called your attention when at Frankfort last,

Comth vs J Webb & others Russell ct ct fine $300 breach of tavern bond --
in this case Webb was more sinned against than sining, his wife was the really guilty person & afterwards left Webb & sued him for divorce -- Considering the prospects of Webbs family & the circumstances of Commission I would respectfully suggest some action in his behalf &c

Comlh vs Fergasun Clinton
petition will be forwarded as I understand, Permit me to say two worse men dont live in the 6th Federal Distrcit. They are outlaws of the worst character -- &c Your reply to Hale meets with universal favor in this country I think Hale rather,, piled up the agony,, and might have had an intimation to that effect
without a breach of hospitality I regard your suggestion of a convention of the southern states as highly very appropriate, and well Considered, I cannot refrain from congratulating you for the whole tenor of the letter, I regard it as a great success, and only regret wish we had more such Governors

Yours Truly
E L Van Winkle

Wayne Cir Ct
$500. } For. Recog
J Marcum
Remission Issd
Jany 15. 1861
